summary: I am going to be in France on the actual election day, so it was important for me to vote as soon as I could here in Ohio, which happens to be today.  I drove over to the Darke County Board of Elections, presented my ID, got my ballot, and then made my choices.  This […]
title: I Voted Early, and You (Probably) Can Too

summary: Discover how the simple idea of "blogging like a painter" can help you overcome the overwhelm and build your blog one step at a time
title: FW: Blog Like a Painter

summary: Time and, indeed, life is what you make of it.  After having to retire early because of a traumatic event in my life back in 2016, I found myself on the precipice of a dark place.  But even then, faced with a dilemma, I had a choice...
title: Time is what you make of it

summary: In the world, some things are treated like immutable natural laws — but can change happen.  And what would happen then.  In Blood of the Old Kings, author Sung-Il Kim (in translation via Anton Hur) looks at what could transpire when characters crave to change the seemingly unchangeable...
title: The Big Idea: Sung-Il Kim

summary: Commercial, Nashville driven country music is horrible Republican brainwashing and serves the power structure, not the people
title: Country Music
The first three months since my return to Linux

summary:
The Wall Street Journal is reporting that Chinese hackers (Salt Typhoon) penetrated the networks of US broadband providers, and might have accessed the backdoors that the federal government uses to execute court-authorized wiretap requests.  Those backdoors have been mandated by law—CALEA—since 1994. 
It’s a weird story...
title: China Possibly Hacking US “Lawful Access” Backdoor
